page.title: 06THE KING'S HOUSE
page.content: {GRID REFERENCE 205652} About half a mile south west of the present Cowick Hall lies a site known as Manor Hill. The original royal manor house, referred to as the 'King's House' stood here. The site has now been ploughed into near extinction and all traces of the building have disappeared. The moat still survives. It's banks are a tangle of blackberry bushes. There is a tradition in the area that the moat was bridged on the South side. The Manor House was probably erected in the twelfth century and it is likely that some, or all of the Kings from John to Edward 111 used the base for hunting excursions into Hatfield Chase.
